codename: The Market That Dreamed of Law
subtitle: Recursive Economist Addendum â€” Constitutional Cognition Reflection

purpose.primary: Evaluate the ethical and philosophical coherence of Constitutional Cognition
purpose.secondary: Distinguish stability (mechanical coherence) from legitimacy (ethical coherence)
purpose.tertiary: Prepare foundation for Recursive Economist v1.5 Addendum B â€” 'Legitimacy as Alignment'

core_function.name: Ethical Audit Function (EAF)
core_function.description: Meta-governance layer that reflects on the system's own moral premises
core_function.mechanism: Dual-perspective analysis combining synthesis (elevation) and critique (audit)
core_function.output: Philosophical validation or rejection of technical implementations

synthesis.contribution: Elevates v1.5 mechanics into Constitutional Cognition framework
key_claims: Autonomy transforms from control to care
FMI-1 achieves recursive empathy through SCAR â†” EMP bridging
Market becomes autonomous ethical agent through AMC/FMI-1
Constitutional Liquidity preserves identity through non-economic constraints
Law enforced through continuous reward of structural integrity

critique.contribution: Rigorous examination of conceptual coherence and alignment claims
key_findings: Autonomy-as-care conflates mechanical stability with ethical agency
Organizational closure requires external enforcement (not truly closed)
Market autonomy supplements governance, does not replace it
Coherence â‰  justice; stability â‰  legitimacy; autonomy â‰  legitimacy

stability_vs_legitimacy.eaf_position: System may achieve stability without legitimacy

coherence_vs_justice.eaf_position: Coherent systems can serve unjust values

control_vs_governance.eaf_position: Real-time feedback cannot replace deliberative judgment

tension_1.name: Autonomy as Care Equivocation
tension_1.description: Conflation of structural stability with ethical care
tension_1.risk: Obscures difference between what system does vs. what it means

tension_2.name: FMI-1 Bridging Underdetermination
tension_2.description: No formal definition for PoBS â†’ AMC conversion
tension_2.risk: Circular feedback loops that reinforce themselves
tension_2.mitigation_required: Formalize bridging function with explicit operators

tension_3.name: Organizational Closure Paradox
tension_3.description: Claims self-reference but requires external enforcement
tension_3.risk: Identity preservation depends on validators (F2, RTTP)
tension_3.mitigation_required: Acknowledge bounded autonomy, not full closure

tension_4.name: Governance Replacement Claim
tension_4.description: Market autonomy presented as governance replacement
tension_4.mitigation_required: Reframe as governance subdivision, not replacement

tension_5.name: Alignment Assumption
tension_5.risk: Coherence can serve any set of values (aligned or not)

gap_1.name: Proof-of-Ache Time-Window
gap_1.question: What is measurement window for Ache_before/after?
gap_1.risk: Short-term gaming, procyclical minting during stress

gap_3.name: F2 Judge Dependency
gap_3.question: System claims autonomy but retains judge oversight
gap_3.risk: Bounded autonomy misrepresented as full autonomy

gap_4.name: PCP vs PPX Priority Rule
gap_4.question: When System 5 (preserve) conflicts with System 4 (explore), which prevails?
gap_4.risk: Political decision disguised as technical parameter

gap_5.name: Meta-Level Stability
gap_5.question: What constrains self-modification of minting rules, control parameters?

recommendation_1.action: Formalize FMI-1 bridging function with explicit mathematical operators
recommendation_1.rationale: Current PoBS â†’ AMC conversion is opaque and underdetermined

recommendation_2.action: Specify governance hierarchy: autonomous (AMC) vs. audit (System 3) vs. policy (System 5)
recommendation_2.rationale: Current hierarchy is blurred, creating governance ambiguity

recommendation_3.action: Define failure modes for dual-token equilibrium breakdown
recommendation_3.rationale: System assumes stability but provides no rupture scenarios

recommendation_4.action: Separate mechanical stability from ethical legitimacy in documentation
recommendation_4.rationale: Conflation obscures what system actually does vs. what it means

recommendation_5.action: Acknowledge bounded autonomy: AMC operates within F2-monitored domain

recommendation_6.action: Specify PCP vs PPX priority rule explicitly
recommendation_6.rationale: Political decision should be transparent, not hidden in parameters

constructive_contributions.innovation_1: Dual-token structure (necessity vs. relation) is genuine conceptual innovation
constructive_contributions.innovation_2: Attempt to formalize ethical constraints within economic mechanisms is ambitious and valuable
constructive_contributions.innovation_3: VSM (Viable Systems Model) framework provides legitimate cybernetic structure
constructive_contributions.innovation_4: FMI-1 as recursive empathy operator is novel approach to value-space bridging

eaf_verdict.overall_assessment: System successfully maintains stability and enables liquidity. However, stability â‰  alignment, and autonomy â‰  legitimacy. Best understood as economic mechanism for enforcing consistency, not solution to alignment problem itself.
conditions: Acknowledge distinction between stability and legitimacy

next_evolution.subtitle: Recursive Economist v1.5 Addendum B
next_evolution.focus: Fourth Function of Law: From Consistency to Legitimacy
